metadata.name: NetraPlatform.CodingConventions
metadata.description: MANDATORY instruction set for all AI agents contributing code to the Netra AI platform.

section.title: Architectural Constraints (The 300/8 Rule)
section.ai-directive: AI agents must proactively enforce these constraints during code generation, initiating refactoring protocols if limits are approached (e.g., 250 lines for files, 6 lines for functions).

constraint.title: File Line Limit (300 Lines)
constraint.instruction: Ensure every source file is 300 lines or less (LOC).
constraint.action-on-violation: Execute 'Extract Module Protocol'. Split the file based on functional boundaries.

constraint.title: Function/Method Line Limit (8 Lines)
constraint.instruction: Ensure every function or method body is 8 lines or less (LOC).
constraint.action-on-violation: Execute 'Extract Function Protocol'. Decompose logic into smaller, named helper functions.

constraint.title: Prohibition of Duplication
constraint.instruction: Do not create duplicate functionality or types. Extend existing implementations.
constraint.ai-directive: Before generating new code or types, search the codebase for existing implementations. If found, IMPORT and USE it. Do not redefine.

constraint.title: Test Code Segregation
constraint.instruction: Do not introduce test stubs or mocks into production service code.

guideline.title: Zustand Individual Selector Pattern
guideline.instruction: Always use individual selectors for accessing Zustand store state. Object-returning selectors are FORBIDDEN as they cause infinite loops.

code-example.before: const selector = (state) => ({ a: state.a, b: state.b }); const data = useStore(selector, shallow);
code-example.after: const a = useStore(state => state.a); const b = useStore(state => state.b);

guideline.instruction: Ensure unique and stable keys for all list renderings.
guideline.pattern: Use `generateUniqueId()` from `@/lib/utils` if no stable ID exists.
guideline.forbidden-pattern: Do NOT use `Date.now()` or array indices as keys.

guideline.title: Service-Based Namespace Pattern - Absolute Imports Only
guideline.instruction: All backend imports must follow the service-based namespace pattern: {top_level_service_name}.{app|tests}. NO relative imports are allowed - use absolute imports exclusively.

before.description: VIOLATION: Old import pattern or relative imports

code-example.before: from netra_backend.app.core.config import Settings from tests.conftest import TestClient from .config import Settings # FORBIDDEN: relative import from ..core.config import Settings # FORBIDDEN: relative import
code-example.after: from netra_backend.app.core.config import Settings from netra_backend.tests.conftest import TestClient # Always use absolute imports with full service namespace

guideline.forbidden-pattern: Relative imports using . or .. are strictly forbidden

guideline.title: Explicit Typing for DB Sessions
guideline.instruction: Explicitly type hint database session dependencies to prevent runtime auth failures.

before.description: VIOLATION: Missing type hint causes errors

guideline.title: Singleton Injection via Provider Functions
guideline.instruction: Inject singleton services using provider functions, not the class directly, to ensure configuration (e.g., secrets) is applied.

section.title: Agent Architecture Naming Conventions
section.instruction: Apply the correct suffix based on the component's role.
section.forbidden: Do NOT use the "Agent" suffix for utility or infrastructure modules.

guideline.title: Feature Flag Driven TDD
guideline.instruction: Utilize the feature flag system for TDD to maintain a 100% CI/CD pass rate during development.

workflow.step: 2. Write test using `@tdd_test("feature_name")` decorator. (Test will be skipped in CI).
4. Update status to "enabled" when implementation is complete and tests pass.

tool.name: Architecture Compliance Check
tool.ai-directive: AI Agent MUST execute this tool before finalizing any code contribution. If violations are detected, initiate the appropriate refactoring protocol (ARC-001 or ARC-002).
